findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The smart contract may allow an unauthorized user to upgrade the script, potentially leading to malicious code execution.

findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The contract allows minting of unlimited number of tokens without any restriction.

findings.title: Unprotected approve function
findings.description: The approve function allows unlimited approval of tokens without any restrictions or checks.

findings.title: Unprotected transfer function
findings.description: The 'transfer' function is unprotected and can be exploited by malicious users.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function is unprotected and can be exploited by malicious users.

findings.title: Unprotected increaseAllowance function
findings.description: The increaseAllowance function does not have any access control or validation, allowing anyone to increase the allowance of an arbitrary user.

findings.title: Unprotected decreaseAllowance function
findings.description: The decreaseAllowance function is unprotected and can be exploited by malicious actors.

findings.title: Unprotected permit function
findings.description: The permit function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential exploitation.

findings.title: Unprotected mint function
findings.description: The mint function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized users to mint tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected burn function
findings.description: The _burn function is internal and lacks access control, allowing unauthorized users to burn tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected swap function
findings.description: The private functions swapAndSendToFee, swapAndLiquify, swapTokensForEth, swapTokensForCake, and swapAndSendDividends are unprotected and can be accessed by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected skim function
findings.description: The skim function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of sensitive data.

findings.title: Unprotected sync function
findings.description: The 'process' function does not have any access modifiers, making it unprotected and accessible by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected initialize function
findings.description: The initialize function is unprotected and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unintended behavior or security risks.

findings.title: Unprotected renounceOwnership function
findings.description: The renounceOwnership function can be called by anyone, allowing them to relinquish ownership of the contract.

findings.title: Unprotected transferOwnership function
findings.description: The transfer of contract ownership can be executed to a specified wallet or a dead address without any protection.
